title: Jaylen Brown listed as doubtful for Celtics’ Thursday game against Washington with a non-COVID illness
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics Brown's illness has put his status for Thursday's game in doubt.
Jaylen Brown AP Photo/Phil Long The Celtics listed Jaylen Brown as doubtful for Thursday’s matchup against the Wizards on their latest injury report, citing a non-COVID illness.
Brown has played in all 21 of the Celtics’ games so far this season.

title: What does Drake ‘Drake Maye’ Maye mean? Even Mike Vrabel and Kayshon Boutte aren’t sure
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I couldn’t even figure out 6-7, and now it’s Drake ‘Drake Maye’ Maye" Vrabel said of the trend.
Drake Maye John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe Having a nickname cited in quotation marks is nothing new, especially in sports.
There’s Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson in wrestling.

title: White Castle automated kiosk debuts at Logan Airport
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Food News It will serve sliders in under two minutes.

Travelers at Boston Logan International Airport can now grab White Castle's hot and tasty beef and chicken Sliders on demand through new automated kiosk partnership White Castle Boston Logan welcomed a surprising new arrival — an automated White Castle slider kiosk.
At first glance, it might look like your average airport vending machine.

title: USA Today has Bill Belichick and UMass coach tied for last in first-year coaching rankings
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Belichick and UMass coach Joe Harasymiak were among three coaches who received "D" grades.
No one got an "F.
" Bill Belichick AP Photo/Chris Seward USA Today gave out letter grades for each of the first year college football coaches at the FBS level, and Bill Belichick’s marks were less than favorable.

title: Mass. manufacturer moving hundreds of jobs to N.H.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Business SynQor’s executives, engineers, technicians, and assembly workers are among the employees whose jobs are being shifted out of state.
Jim Cole/AP Photo, File By Abby Patkin December 3, 2025 | 4:19 PM 1 minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A Boxborough-based manufacturer is shifting its operations to New Hampshire early next year, uprooting hundreds of workers in the process.

title: Boston Legacy FC sign Boston College midfielder Sophia Lowenberg
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Sports News During her four seasons at Boston College, Lowenberg scored seven goals and provided two assists.
Boston Legacy FC announce the signing of Sophia Lowenberg (Boston Legacy FC).
As Boston Legacy FC prepare for their inaugural season in the NWSL, they announced the signing of midfielder Sophia Lowenberg on Wednesday.

title: Drake Maye MVP odds: Patriots QB overtakes Matthew Stafford as favorite
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots With four games left, Maye leads the shortlist of contenders for the award.
AP Photo/Steven Senne ShareSend this article to your social connections.

‘This offense is awesome’: ESPN analyst explained Patriots’ fundamental success with Drake Maye Patriots’ rematch with Bills reportedly won’t be flexed to primetime It took second-year Patriots quarterback Drake Maye less than 30 career NFL games to emerge as a serious contender for the league’s Most Valuable Player award.

title: Prosecutors say alleged Woburn ATM bomber looked up articles about blast
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Christopher Silva is due for arraignment next week on a charge of maliciously damaging property used in interstate commerce.
Christopher Silva, 43, was arrested at his Stoneham home in late October after authorities allege he blew up an ATM in Woburn.
Woburn Police Department By Abby Patkin December 3, 2025 | 2:40 PM 1 minute to read As authorities began investigating a mysterious explosion at a Woburn ATM on Sept.

title: Drake Maye takes home AFC Offensive Player of the Week honors
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye threw for 282 yards and two touchdowns in Monday's win over the Giants.
Drake Maye is a top contender for NFL MVP honors this season.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan December 3, 2025 | 2:38 PM 1 minute to read After helping the Patriots win their 10th-straight game with a lopsided victory over the Giants on Monday, Drake Maye was named AFC Offensive Player of the Week on Wednesday afternoon.
